{{iPhone models}}
{{iPhone models}}
The second-generation '''iPhone SE''' (also known as the '''iPhone SE 2''' or the '''iPhone SE 2020''') is a [[smartphone]] developed and marketed by [[Apple Inc.]] It is part of the [[List of iPhone models|13th generation]] of the [[iPhone]], alongside the [[iPhone 11]] and [[iPhone 11 Pro|11 Pro/Pro Max]] models. Apple announced it on April 15, 2020, coinciding with the discontinuation of the [[iPhone 8|iPhone 8 and 8 Plus]]. Orders began on April 17, 2020, and the phone was released on April 24, 2020.<ref name="release">{{cite web |author=Apple |date=April 15, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=Apple Newsroom (apple.com) |title=iPhone SE: A powerful new smartphone in a popular design - Apple |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200428153235/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-date=April 28, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> It was released with a starting price of {{currency|399}}, and positioned as a budget phone.<ref name="cnet">{{cite web |author=Sareena Dayaram |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=CNET (cnet.com) |title=How iPhone SE 2020 specs compare to old iPhone SE, iPhone 8, iPhone XR, iPhone 11 - CNET |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |archive-date=May 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200512091658/https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Annie Gaus |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 11, 2020 |publisher=TheStreet (TheStreet.com) |title=Who Apple Is Targeting With Its New iPhone SE - TheStreet |url=https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |archive-date=May 14, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200514051230/https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |url-status=live }}</ref>
The second-generation '''iPhone SE''' (also known as the '''iPhone SE 2''' or the '''iPhone SE 2020''') is a [[smartphone]] developed and marketed by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]. It is part of the [[List of iPhone models|13th generation]] of the [[iPhone]], alongside the [[iPhone 11]] and [[iPhone 11 Pro|11 Pro/Pro Max]] models. Apple announced it on April 15, 2020, coinciding with the discontinuation of the [[iPhone 8|iPhone 8 and 8 Plus]]. Orders began on April 17, 2020, and the phone was released on April 24, 2020.<ref name="release">{{cite web |author=Apple |date=April 15, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=Apple Newsroom (apple.com) |title=iPhone SE: A powerful new smartphone in a popular design - Apple |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200428153235/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-date=April 28, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> It was released with a starting price of {{currency|399}}, and positioned as a budget phone.<ref name="cnet">{{cite web |author=Sareena Dayaram |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=CNET (cnet.com) |title=How iPhone SE 2020 specs compare to old iPhone SE, iPhone 8, iPhone XR, iPhone 11 - CNET |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |archive-date=May 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200512091658/https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Annie Gaus |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 11, 2020 |publisher=TheStreet (TheStreet.com) |title=Who Apple Is Targeting With Its New iPhone SE - TheStreet |url=https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |archive-date=May 14, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200514051230/https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |url-status=live }}</ref>


Following the pattern of the first iPhone SE (which shares the form factor of the [[iPhone 5s]], with the internal hardware of the [[iPhone 6s]]), the second-generation model shares the form factor of the iPhone 8, with internal components from the iPhone 11 lineup. It has components such as the [[Apple A13]] Bionic [[system on a chip|system-on-chip]], which allows the phone to utilize the single wide-angle lens Portrait Mode, as on the [[iPhone XR]]. It also features Smart HDR-2 photos, which are marketed as being better than Smart HDR photos on the [[iPhone XS]] and iPhone XR.<ref>{{cite news |last=Peters |first=Jay |url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size |title=How the second-gen iPhone SE compares to the iPhone 11 |date=15 April 2020 |work=The Verge |access-date=18 April 2020 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200419133930/https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size |archive-date=April 19, 2020}}</ref><ref name="msn">{{cite web |author=Stephen Shankland |date=April 24, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=MSN News (MSN.com) |title=iPhone SE outclasses all Android phones thanks to Apple's A13 chip |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200429084339/https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-date=April 29, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref>
Following the pattern of the first iPhone SE (which shares the form factor of the [[iPhone 5s]], with the internal hardware of the [[iPhone 6s]]), the second-generation model shares the form factor of the iPhone 8, with internal components from the iPhone 11 lineup. It has components such as the [[Apple A13]] Bionic [[system on a chip|system-on-chip]], which allows the phone to utilize the single wide-angle lens Portrait Mode, as on the [[iPhone XR]]. It also features Smart HDR-2 photos, which are marketed as being better than Smart HDR photos on the [[iPhone XS]] and iPhone XR.<ref>{{cite news |last=Peters |first=Jay |url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size |title=How the second-gen iPhone SE compares to the iPhone 11 |date=15 April 2020 |work=The Verge |access-date=18 April 2020 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200419133930/https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size |archive-date=April 19, 2020}}</ref><ref name="msn">{{cite web |author=Stephen Shankland |date=April 24, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=MSN News (MSN.com) |title=iPhone SE outclasses all Android phones thanks to Apple's A13 chip |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200429084339/https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-date=April 29, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref>

summary.reason: The change is a minor formatting edit, specifically removing 'Inc' from 'Apple Inc' and adding a pipe symbol for disambiguation.
summary.summary: Minor formatting change to the name 'Apple Inc' with no new information.

changes.diff:
Line 96: Line 96:

=== Software ===
=== Software ===
{{See also|iOS|iOS 13|iOS 14|iOS 15|iOS 16|iOS 17|iOS 18}}
{{See also|iOS|iOS 13|iOS 14|iOS 15|iOS 16|iOS 17|iOS 18|iOS 26}}
The iPhone SE was originally supplied with [[iOS 13|iOS 13.4]],<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ios.gadgethacks.com/news/apples-ios-13-4-1-fixes-facetime-bug-now-available-for-2020-iphone-se-0284197/|title=Apple's iOS 13.4.1 Fixes FaceTime Bug, Now Available for 2020 iPhone SE|website=Gadget Hacks|date=April 7, 2020 |access-date=April 26, 2020|archive-date=May 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200516082030/https://ios.gadgethacks.com/news/apples-ios-13-4-1-fixes-facetime-bug-now-available-for-2020-iphone-se-0284197/|url-status=live}}</ref> supporting [[Apple Pay]] and the [[Apple Card]].<ref name="Apple official website: specifications" /> iOS 13.4.1, an update fixing bugs related to [[Bluetooth]] and [[FaceTime]], was released on April 23, 2020 (a day prior to the device's official release), making it a day-one software update.<ref>{{Cite web|title=About iOS 13 Updates|url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210393|website=Apple Support|language=en|access-date=2020-05-12|archive-date=May 1, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200501081057/https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210393|url-status=live}}</ref>
The iPhone SE was originally supplied with [[iOS 13|iOS 13.4]],<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ios.gadgethacks.com/news/apples-ios-13-4-1-fixes-facetime-bug-now-available-for-2020-iphone-se-0284197/|title=Apple's iOS 13.4.1 Fixes FaceTime Bug, Now Available for 2020 iPhone SE|website=Gadget Hacks|date=April 7, 2020 |access-date=April 26, 2020|archive-date=May 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200516082030/https://ios.gadgethacks.com/news/apples-ios-13-4-1-fixes-facetime-bug-now-available-for-2020-iphone-se-0284197/|url-status=live}}</ref> supporting [[Apple Pay]] and the [[Apple Card]].<ref name="Apple official website: specifications" /> iOS 13.4.1, an update fixing bugs related to [[Bluetooth]] and [[FaceTime]], was released on April 23, 2020 (a day prior to the device's official release), making it a day-one software update.<ref>{{Cite web|title=About iOS 13 Updates|url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210393|website=Apple Support|language=en|access-date=2020-05-12|archive-date=May 1, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200501081057/https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210393|url-status=live}}</ref>


The iPhone SE has received updates to every version of [[iOS]] since, including the latest version, [[iOS 18]], released in 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 18 |url=https://www.apple.com/au/ios/ios-18/ |access-date=2024-09-22 |website=Apple (Australia) |language=en-AU}}</ref>
The iPhone SE has received updates to every version of [[iOS]] since, including the latest version, [[iOS 26]], released in 2025.<ref>{{Cite web |title=OS - iOS 26 |url=https://www.apple.com/os/ios/ |access-date=2025-09-16 |website=Apple |language=en-US}}</ref>


== Controversy ==
== Controversy ==

summary.reason: The change updates the latest iOS version to iOS 26, which is a significant update indicating the passage of several years and likely substantial software changes.
summary.summary: Updated the latest iOS version supported by the iPhone SE from iOS 18 (2024) to iOS 26 (2025).

The second-generation '''iPhone SE''' (also known as the '''iPhone SE 2''' or the '''iPhone SE 2020''') is a [[smartphone]] developed and marketed by [[Apple Inc.]] It is part of the [[List of iPhone models|13th generation]] of the [[iPhone]], alongside the [[iPhone 11]] and [[iPhone 11 Pro|11 Pro/Pro Max]] models. Apple announced it on April 15, 2020, coinciding with the discontinuation of the [[iPhone 8|iPhone 8 and 8 Plus]]. Orders began on April 17, 2020, and the phone was released on April 24, 2020.<ref name="release">{{cite web |author=Apple |date=April 15, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=Apple Newsroom (apple.com) |title=iPhone SE: A powerful new smartphone in a popular design - Apple |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200428153235/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-date=April 28, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> It was released with a starting price of {{currency|399}}, and positioned as a budget phone.<ref name="cnet">{{cite web |author=Sareena Dayaram |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=CNET (cnet.com) |title=How iPhone SE 2020 specs compare to old iPhone SE, iPhone 8, iPhone XR, iPhone 11 - CNET |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |archive-date=May 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200512091658/https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Annie Gaus |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 11, 2020 |publisher=TheStreet (TheStreet.com) |title=Who Apple Is Targeting With Its New iPhone SE - TheStreet |url=https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |archive-date=May 14, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200514051230/https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |url-status=live }}</ref>
The second-generation '''iPhone SE''' (also known as the '''iPhone SE 2''' or the '''iPhone SE 2020''') is a [[smartphone]] developed and marketed by [[Apple Inc.]] It is part of the [[List of iPhone models|13th generation]] of the [[iPhone]], alongside the [[iPhone 11]] and [[iPhone 11 Pro|11 Pro/Pro Max]] models. Apple announced it on April 15, 2020, coinciding with the discontinuation of the [[iPhone 8|iPhone 8 and 8 Plus]]. Orders began on April 17, 2020, and the phone was released on April 24, 2020.<ref name="release">{{cite web |author=Apple |date=April 15, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=Apple Newsroom (apple.com) |title=iPhone SE: A powerful new smartphone in a popular design - Apple |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200428153235/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/iphone-se-a-powerful-new-smartphone-in-a-popular-design/ |archive-date=April 28, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> It was released with a starting price of {{currency|399}}, and positioned as a budget phone.<ref name="cnet">{{cite web |author=Sareena Dayaram |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=CNET (cnet.com) |title=How iPhone SE 2020 specs compare to old iPhone SE, iPhone 8, iPhone XR, iPhone 11 - CNET |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |archive-date=May 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200512091658/https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-se-2020-specs-compare-old-iphone-se-iphone-8-iphone-xr-iphone-11/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Annie Gaus |date=May 6, 2020 |access-date=May 11, 2020 |publisher=TheStreet (TheStreet.com) |title=Who Apple Is Targeting With Its New iPhone SE - TheStreet |url=https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |archive-date=May 14, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200514051230/https://www.thestreet.com/investing/apple-takes-aim-at-android-users-with-iphone-se |url-status=live }}</ref>


Following the pattern of the first iPhone SE (which shares the form factor of the [[iPhone 5s]], with the internal hardware of the [[iPhone 6s]]), the second-generation model shares the form factor of the iPhone 8, with internal components from the iPhone 11 lineup. It has components such as the [[Apple A13]] Bionic [[system on a chip|system-on-chip]], which allows the phone to utilize the single wide-angle lens Portrait Mode, as on the [[iPhone XR]]. It also features Smart HDR-2 photos, which are marketed as being better than Smart HDR photos on the [[iPhone XS]] and iPhone XR.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Peters|first=Jay|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size|title=How the second-gen iPhone SE compares to the iPhone 11|date=15 April 2020|work=The Verge|access-date=18 April 2020|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200419133930/https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size|archive-date=April 19, 2020}}</ref><ref name="msn">{{cite web |author=Stephen Shankland |date=April 24, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=MSN News (MSN.com) |title=iPhone SE outclasses all Android phones thanks to Apple's A13 chip |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200429084339/https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-date=April 29, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref>
Following the pattern of the first iPhone SE (which shares the form factor of the [[iPhone 5s]], with the internal hardware of the [[iPhone 6s]]), the second-generation model shares the form factor of the iPhone 8, with internal components from the iPhone 11 lineup. It has components such as the [[Apple A13]] Bionic [[system on a chip|system-on-chip]], which allows the phone to utilize the single wide-angle lens Portrait Mode, as on the [[iPhone XR]]. It also features Smart HDR-2 photos, which are marketed as being better than Smart HDR photos on the [[iPhone XS]] and iPhone XR.<ref>{{cite news |last=Peters |first=Jay |url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size |title=How the second-gen iPhone SE compares to the iPhone 11 |date=15 April 2020 |work=The Verge |access-date=18 April 2020 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200419133930/https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21221293/iphone-se-vs-11-pro-specs-comparison-price-camera-size |archive-date=April 19, 2020}}</ref><ref name="msn">{{cite web |author=Stephen Shankland |date=April 24, 2020 |access-date=May 6, 2020 |publisher=MSN News (MSN.com) |title=iPhone SE outclasses all Android phones thanks to Apple's A13 chip |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200429084339/https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/iphone-se-outclasses-all-android-phones-thanks-to-apples-a13-chip/ar-BB139QeU |archive-date=April 29, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref>


== History ==
== History ==
A successor to the first-generation [[iPhone SE (1st generation)|iPhone SE]] had been rumored since 2017, the year after the original was released.<ref>{{Cite web |url = https://www.macrumors.com/2017/11/22/iphone-se-2-release-date-first-half-2018/ |title = iPhone SE 2 Again Rumored to Launch in First Half of 2018 |website = MacRumors |date = November 22, 2017 |language = en |access-date = April 15, 2020 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200407171103/https://www.macrumors.com/2017/11/22/iphone-se-2-release-date-first-half-2018/ |archive-date = April 7, 2020 |url-status = live }}</ref> The name was also subject to speculation. Guesses included (most prevalently) iPhone SE 2, iPhone SE 2020, and iPhone 9 due to design similarities with the iPhone 8.
A successor to the first-generation [[iPhone SE (1st generation)|iPhone SE]] had been rumored since 2017, the year after the original was released.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.macrumors.com/2017/11/22/iphone-se-2-release-date-first-half-2018/ |title = iPhone SE 2 Again Rumored to Launch in First Half of 2018 |website = MacRumors |date = November 22, 2017 |language = en |access-date = April 15, 2020 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200407171103/https://www.macrumors.com/2017/11/22/iphone-se-2-release-date-first-half-2018/ |archive-date = April 7, 2020 |url-status = live }}</ref> The name was also subject to speculation. Guesses included (most prevalently) iPhone SE 2, iPhone SE 2020, and iPhone 9 due to design similarities with the iPhone 8.


In March 2020, cases for the phone were reportedly being supplied to [[Best Buy]],<ref name="9to5mac">{{Cite web |url = https://9to5mac.com/2020/03/30/iphone-9-case-inventory-best-buy/ |title = iPhone 9 case inventory arriving at Best Buy, other retailers with April 5 merchandising date |last = Miller |first = Chance |date = March 30, 2020 |access-date = April 3, 2020 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200403181051/https://9to5mac.com/2020/03/30/iphone-9-case-inventory-best-buy/ |archive-date = April 3, 2020 |url-status = live }}</ref> showing an iPhone with an [[iPhone 8]]-sized body and a single camera lens.<ref name="9to5mac" /> [[Belkin]] screen protectors for the iPhone SE were also listed on the online [[Apple Store]], cross-compatible with the base models of the iPhones [[iPhone 6|6]], [[iPhone 6S|6S]], [[iPhone 7|7]], and 8. However, references to the iPhone SE were quickly removed.<ref>{{Cite web |url = https://www.tomsguide.com/news/apple-iphone-9-will-be-the-new-iphone-se |title = iPhone 9 will be called iPhone SE and could launch soon (Update) |website = Tom's Guide |date = April 3, 2020 |access-date = April 3, 2020 |archive-date = May 16, 2020 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200516082030/https://www.tomsguide.com/news/apple-iphone-9-will-be-the-new-iphone-se |url-status = live }}</ref><ref name="9to5mac" />
In March 2020, cases for the phone were reportedly being supplied to [[Best Buy]],<ref name="9to5mac">{{Cite web |url = https://9to5mac.com/2020/03/30/iphone-9-case-inventory-best-buy/ |title = iPhone 9 case inventory arriving at Best Buy, other retailers with April 5 merchandising date |last = Miller |first = Chance |date = March 30, 2020 |access-date = April 3, 2020 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200403181051/https://9to5mac.com/2020/03/30/iphone-9-case-inventory-best-buy/ |archive-date = April 3, 2020 |url-status = live }}</ref> showing an iPhone with an [[iPhone 8]]-sized body and a single camera lens.<ref name="9to5mac" /> [[Belkin]] screen protectors for the iPhone SE were also listed on the online [[Apple Store]], cross-compatible with the base models of the iPhones [[iPhone 6|6]], [[iPhone 6S|6S]], [[iPhone 7|7]], and 8. However, references to the iPhone SE were quickly removed.<ref>{{Cite web |url = https://www.tomsguide.com/news/apple-iphone-9-will-be-the-new-iphone-se |title = iPhone 9 will be called iPhone SE and could launch soon (Update) |website = Tom's Guide |date = April 3, 2020 |access-date = April 3, 2020 |archive-date = May 16, 2020 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200516082030/https://www.tomsguide.com/news/apple-iphone-9-will-be-the-new-iphone-se |url-status = live }}</ref><ref name="9to5mac" />

=== Hardware ===
=== Hardware ===
The iPhone SE incorporates the Apple A13 Bionic (7 nm) architecture [[system on a chip]] (SoC), with an integrated [[Apple motion coprocessors|M13 motion coprocessor]] and third-generation neural engine.<ref name="msn" /> It is available in three internal storage configurations: 64 GB, 128 GB, and 256 GB.<ref name="Apple official website: specifications" /> The SE has the same [[IP Code|IP67]] rating for dust and water resistance as the iPhone 8.<ref name="Apple official website: specifications" /> The phone lacks the [[ultra-wideband]] features enabled by the [[Apple silicon#Apple U1|U1 chip]] found in the iPhone 11 and 11 Pro.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://appleinsider.com/articles/20/04/15/apples-new-iphone-se-doesnt-have-a-u1-ultra-wideband-chip|title=Apple's new iPhone SE doesn't have a U1 Ultra Wideband chip|website=appleinsider|last=Peterson|first=Mike|date=April 15, 2020|access-date=April 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200416075006/https://appleinsider.com/articles/20/04/15/apples-new-iphone-se-doesnt-have-a-u1-ultra-wideband-chip|archive-date=April 16, 2020|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="iPhone Hacks">{{Cite web|url=http://www.iphonehacks.com/2020/04/2020-iphone-se-misses-features.html|title=2020 iPhone SE Misses Out On These 5 Features|website=iPhone Hacks|date=April 23, 2020 |url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200426154415/http://www.iphonehacks.com/2020/04/2020-iphone-se-misses-features.html|archive-date=April 26, 2020|access-date=April 26, 2020}}</ref> Despite the phone's smaller size which may lead to increased thermal throttling, the SE's A13 SoC runs at the same peak CPU frequencies as the iPhone 11.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Frumusanu |first1=Andrei |title=The iPhone SE (2020) Hands-On Quick Review: A Reinvigorated Classic |url=https://www.anandtech.com/show/15745/the-iphone-se-2020-quick-review-reinvigorated-classic/2 |website=AnandTech |access-date=May 2, 2020 |date=April 24, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200504015401/https://www.anandtech.com/show/15745/the-iphone-se-2020-quick-review-reinvigorated-classic/2 |archive-date=May 4, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> Like the iPhone 7 and 8 that were previously available in the same form factor, but unlike the iPhone 6, 6S and first-generation iPhone SE, the second-generation iPhone SE does not feature a standard 3.5 mm [[Phone connector (audio)|stereo headphone jack]].<ref name="cnet"/>

=== Design ===
=== Design ===
[[File:IPhone SE (2020) Product Red.jpg|thumb|right|Back of second iPhone SE in Product Red]]
[[File:IPhone SE (2020) Product Red.jpg|thumb|right|Back of the second generation iPhone SE in Product Red]]
The iPhone SE features an aluminum frame, paired with a glass front and back. It shares the same physical sizes and dimensions as the [[iPhone 8]] and is externally identical, except for a centered Apple logo and the removal of the iPhone branding in the lower midsection. As a result, phone cases made to fit the iPhone 8 will also fit the iPhone SE.
The iPhone SE features an aluminum frame, paired with a glass front and back. It shares the same physical sizes and dimensions as the [[iPhone 8]] and is externally identical, except for a centered Apple logo and the removal of the iPhone branding in the lower midsection. As a result, phone cases made to fit the iPhone 8 will also fit the iPhone SE.
